hero.title: Real-World Use Cases
hero.description: Discover how ClinvetIA transforms veterinary care every day, solving real situations from clinics just like yours.

cases.title: Night Emergency: Persistent Vomiting
cases.context: Luna, a 3-year-old golden retriever, starts vomiting repeatedly at 2 AM. Her owner, Miguel, is worried because it won't stop and doesn't know if he should go to the ER or wait until morning.
cases.problem: Miguel calls the clinic, but it's closed. The answering machine tells him to call during business hours. Without guidance, he decides to wait until morning. By 8 AM, Luna is dehydrated and weak. The situation worsened due to lack of early attention.
cases.solution: Miguel contacts ClinvetIA at 2 AM. The assistant asks about symptoms, frequency, and Luna's behavior. With this information, ClinvetIA identifies signs of possible intestinal obstruction and recommends going to the ER immediately. It also automatically schedules a priority appointment and sends the information to the on-call veterinarian.
cases.impact: Luna receives care at 3 AM, the obstruction is confirmed, and surgery is successful. Miguel greatly values the immediate response. The clinic captures an emergency case that would have otherwise gone to the competition, generating €850 in revenue and building loyalty with a high-value client.

cases.title: Diabetes Follow-up: Insulin Adjustment
cases.context: Toby, a 9-year-old Persian cat with diabetes, is on insulin treatment. His owner, Carmen, notices Toby is more lethargic and drinking less water than before. She doesn't know if this is good, bad, or if she should adjust the dose.
cases.problem: Carmen calls Friday afternoon, but the clinic is already closed. She has doubts about the weekend dose. She tries to remember what they told her at the last visit 3 weeks ago, but she's not sure. She decides to keep the current dose, although she's worried it might not be correct.
cases.solution: Carmen writes to ClinvetIA: 'Toby is calmer and drinking less, should I adjust the insulin?' ClinvetIA accesses Toby's history, reviews the latest glucose measurements, and asks about specific symptoms. It detects these are signs of mild hypoglycemia and recommends slightly reducing the dose. It sends written instructions and schedules a glucose check for Monday.
cases.impact: Carmen safely adjusts the dose over the weekend. On Monday, Toby arrives stable for the check. The clinic avoids an ER visit for severe hypoglycemia (saving stress and €200 for Carmen) and reinforces confidence in chronic follow-up. Toby remains stable, and Carmen renews the treatment plan for 6 more months.

cases.title: Vaccine Reminder: Automatic Capture
cases.context: The 'VetSalud' clinic has 340 patients with vaccines expiring in the next 30 days. The administrative team sends manual email reminders, but the response rate is 18%. Many clients forget the appointment or postpone it indefinitely.
cases.problem: The manual process consumes 6 hours per week from the receptionist. Emails get lost in crowded inboxes. Clients don't respond or say 'I'll call later,' but never do. The clinic loses recurring revenue and patients remain unprotected.
cases.solution: ClinvetIA sends personalized WhatsApp reminders 15 days before expiration: 'Hi Ana, Max's vaccine expires on March 20. Does Saturday the 18th at 11 AM work for you?' If the client responds 'yes,' ClinvetIA automatically schedules. If they say 'I can't that day,' it offers 3 alternatives. If no response, it sends a second reminder 7 days before.
cases.impact: Response rate increases to 64%. The clinic schedules 210 vaccination appointments in one month (previously 61). Additional revenue: €3,150/month. Time saved: 24 hours/month. Patients are protected and owners appreciate the clinic's proactivity.

cases.title: Preventive Consultation: Early Detection
cases.context: Rocky, a 7-year-old Labrador, comes in for his annual checkup. During the consultation, the veterinarian notices a small lump on his abdomen. The owner, Laura, hadn't noticed it. The vet recommends a follow-up ultrasound in 2 weeks.
cases.problem: Laura leaves the clinic intending to call to schedule the ultrasound, but between work and family, she forgets. 6 weeks pass. No one from the clinic follows up because the system has no automatic alerts for this type of indication. When Laura finally remembers, the lump has grown.
cases.solution: At the end of the consultation, the veterinarian records in the system: 'Ultrasound check in 2 weeks for abdominal lump.' ClinvetIA automatically sends a message to Laura 10 days later: 'Hi Laura, Dr. Gomez indicated a follow-up ultrasound for Rocky. Does Thursday the 14th at 4 PM work for you?' Laura confirms instantly.
cases.impact: Rocky receives the ultrasound on time. A benign lipoma is detected that only requires observation. Laura feels cared for and trusts that the clinic is looking out for Rocky's health. The clinic ensures continuity of care, improves clinical outcomes, and generates an additional €90 for the ultrasound that would have otherwise been lost.

cases.title: Multiple Services Management: Grooming + Consultation
cases.context: 'Happy Paws' clinic offers veterinary consultations, grooming, and product sales. Many clients bring their pet for grooming but aren't aware they need booster vaccines or deworming. There's no connection between services.
cases.problem: Marta takes her cocker 'Coco' to grooming every 6 weeks. The groomer sees that Coco has very long nails and matted fur, but doesn't have access to the medical history. No one mentions to Marta that Coco needs his annual vaccine. Marta leaves with only the grooming service (€35) and the clinic misses the opportunity to offer comprehensive care.
cases.solution: When Marta schedules the grooming appointment via WhatsApp, ClinvetIA automatically reviews Coco's history and detects that his annual vaccine expires in 10 days. It sends: 'Hi Marta, while Coco is at grooming on Saturday, would you like to take advantage of his annual vaccine? I'll reserve 15 minutes with Dr. Lopez at the end.' Marta accepts.
cases.impact: Coco leaves groomed and vaccinated in a single visit. Marta saves an extra trip and values the convenience. The clinic bills €35 (grooming) + €45 (vaccine) = €80 instead of €35. It also reinforces cross-selling between services and improves the client experience.

cases.title: Test Results Analysis: Proactive Communication
cases.context: Bella, a 5-year-old German shepherd, dropped off blood and urine samples on Monday for routine analysis. The results arrive on Wednesday, but the veterinarian is in surgery all afternoon. The owner, Sofia, doesn't know when to call or if the results are ready yet.
cases.problem: Sofia calls Wednesday at 6 PM, but the receptionist tells her that Dr. Martinez is busy and 'we'll call you.' Two days pass. Sofia calls again Friday. They tell her everything is fine, but give no details. Sofia feels ignored and frustrated. The post-sale experience is poor, even though the clinical service was excellent.
cases.solution: When Bella's results arrive in the system on Wednesday, ClinvetIA automatically sends a message to Sofia: 'Hi Sofia, Bella's test results are ready. Everything is within normal values. Dr. Martinez will review the details with you tomorrow Thursday at 10 AM by video call or phone, which do you prefer?' Sofia chooses phone and receives the full explanation the next day.
cases.impact: Sofia feels informed and calm. Dr. Martinez can review the results calmly, without interruptions. The clinic improves the client experience, reduces repetitive calls to reception (saves 20 min), and reinforces the perception of professionalism and personalized care.

cases.title: First Visit: Converting Consultations into Loyal Clients
cases.context: Luna is a new 3-month-old puppy. Her owners write asking about vaccines, food, and the first visit.
cases.problem: Without follow-up, they leave with doubts and may not return. The opportunity to create a lifelong client is lost.
cases.solution: ClinvetIA schedules the first visit, sends calendar reminders with everything they need (vaccines, deworming), and follows up after the visit.
cases.impact: Higher conversion from first consultation to recurring client. Estimated lifetime customer value: ~$2,400 over 10 years.

cases.title: Cancellations and Waitlist: Slot Optimization
cases.context: It's Tuesday and there are 3 cancellations for Thursday. The schedule has gaps.
cases.problem: The team doesn't have time to call all patients on the waitlist, and the slots go unused.
cases.solution: ClinvetIA automatically contacts patients on the waitlist with available slots and confirms in one message.
cases.impact: Recovering lost slots: ~$120 per appointment and reduced administrative time for the receptionist.

cases.title: WhatsApp Consultation: Smart Triage
cases.context: Maria sends a photo of Max's stool with a message: 'He looks weird, what's wrong with him?'
cases.problem: The receptionist doesn't know how to respond without seeing the animal, and the consultation goes unanswered or gets referred to phone calls.
cases.solution: ClinvetIA asks structured questions (how long, appetite, behavior), classifies urgency, and refers to the vet or schedules an appointment.
cases.impact: 40% of consultations are resolved without an in-person visit, saving time for the team and providing quick response to the client.

cases.title: Medication Reminder: Therapeutic Adherence
cases.context: Rocky needs antibiotics for 10 days. The owner forgets to give the pill and calls late.
cases.problem: Incomplete treatments reduce efficacy and the client returns for consultation due to no improvement.
cases.solution: ClinvetIA sends daily WhatsApp reminders with instructions and confirms if the dose was administered.
cases.impact: Improvement in therapeutic adherence from 60% to 90% and fewer consultations due to relapse.

what.title: What it is

Triage: separates emergencies (vomiting, accidents) from routine requests (grooming, vaccines).

steps: Define your triage protocol and key questions for each type of inquiry.
Configure the flow: symptoms -> urgent/routine -> appointment proposal.
Enable escalation rules for complex cases or severe red flags.
Start handling conversations and review the cases that need human attention.

items: Detects red flags and escalates real emergencies.
Does not diagnose: guides and proposes a vet appointment.
Confirms details before booking (pet, vaccines, allergies).
Keeps a professional tone for worried owners.
